title: 48 Hours of Adrenaline
suitableFor: Experienced adventurers, thrill-seeking groups, confident hikers with a head for heights, and those comfortable with challenging physical activities.
notSuitableFor: Those with a fear of heights, limited mobility, or pre-existing health conditions. Not suitable for families with young children.

stops.title: Velocity 2 Zip Line
stops.description: Experience the fastest zip line in the world, flying over Penrhyn Quarry at speeds of over 100mph. Prepare for an unforgettable adrenaline rush.

wetAlt.title: Bounce Below
wetAlt.description: Jump and explore in giant trampolines inside a disused slate mine at Zip World Llechwedd.

budgetAlt.title: Mountain Biking - MinorTaur trail at Coed y Brenin
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a scenic and free mountain bike ride with moderate difficulty

stops.title: Lizzies cafe
stops.description: A traditional cafe in Blaenau Ffestiniog, serving classic Welsh dishes and hearty meals.

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at Llyn Stwlan viewpoint
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy your own sandwiches with stunning views of the reservoir.

stops.title: White Water Rafting
stops.description: Paddle down the Tryweryn River at the National White Water Centre, tackling thrilling rapids and navigating challenging sections.
stops.travelToNext: 1 hour drive to YHA Snowdon Pen-y-Pass

wetAlt.title: National White Water Centre Cafe Visit
wetAlt.description: Enjoy lunch at the centre's cafe and watch the white water rafters from the comfort of indoors.

budgetAlt.title: Gorge Walking
budgetAlt.description: Explore the gorge by Adventure Britain near Bala for a half day

stops.title: YHA Snowdon Pen-y-Pass
stops.description: A hostel perfectly located for hiking Snowdon and surrounding peaks. Basic but clean and ideal for adventurers.

budgetAlt.title: The Snowdon Inn (Y Fricsan) Camping
budgetAlt.description: Basic campsite, close to town of Llanberis, cheaper

stops.title: Crib Goch Guided Walk
stops.description: A challenging scramble across the knife-edge ridge of Crib Goch, offering breathtaking views of Snowdonia. This is an advanced hike for experienced mountaineers only.

wetAlt.title: Snowdon Summit Hike
wetAlt.description: Hike to the summit of Snowdon via the Llanberis Path. A less exposed, but still challenging, alternative.

budgetAlt.title: Llanberis Path Guided Walk
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a guided walk up the Snowdon Llanberis path with MountainXperience

stops.title: Coasteering Classic
stops.description: Explore the rugged Pembrokeshire coastline with TYF Adventure, swimming, climbing, and jumping into the sea. Experience the thrill of the ocean!

wetAlt.title: Abereiddy Blue Lagoon
wetAlt.description: Swim in the calm, sheltered waters of Abereiddy Blue Lagoon

budgetAlt.title: Coastal Walk
budgetAlt.description: Take a scenic walk along the Pembrokeshire Coast Path, enjoying the stunning views and fresh sea air.

stops.title: TYF Cliff-top Campsite
stops.description: A campsite with beautiful views close to the sea. Perfect for the evening.

budgetAlt.title: St Davids YHA
budgetAlt.description: Another budget accommodation in the area

knowBeforeYouGo.weather: North Wales weather is notoriously unpredictable. Be prepared for all conditions, even in summer. Mountain weather can change rapidly.
knowBeforeYouGo.traffic: Traffic around Snowdonia can be heavy, especially during peak season. Allow extra time for travel and book parking in advance where possible. St Davids can also get very busy in summer.
knowBeforeYouGo.booking: Advance booking is essential for all Zip World activities, the National White Water Centre, and guided walks up Crib Goch. Accommodation should also be booked well in advance.
knowBeforeYouGo.fitness: This itinerary is physically demanding and requires a good level of fitness. Crib Goch is a serious undertaking and should only be attempted by experienced hikers. Coasteering also requires confidence in the water.
